title: 2012 China Banking Association - Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards Announced in Haikou
summary: Citibank (China) Co. Ltd. ("Citi") and the China Banking Association announced the winners of the eighth annual Microentrepreneurship Awards in China. The awards ceremony to commend the outstanding microentrepreneurs and institutions in the microfinance field in the past year was held in Haikou with more than 150 microfinance practitioners in attendance.
tag-1: 2012 China Banking Association - Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards Announced in Haikou
tag-3: Citibank (China) Co. Ltd. ("Citi") and the China Banking Association announced the winners of the eighth annual Microentrepreneurship Awards in China. The awards ceremony to commend the outstanding microentrepreneurs and institutions in the microfinance field in the past year was held in Haikou with more than 150 microfinance practitioners in attendance.
tag-4: The annual Microentrepreneurship Awards, sponsored by the Citi Foundation and carried out by the China Banking Association, has been successfully held in China for seven years since 2005. It has become the largest and most influential annual event for Chinese microfinance practitioners to interact with and learn from each other. Wu Xiaoling, Vice Chairwoman of the Financial and Economic Affairs Committee of the National People's Congress and former Vice Governor of People's Bank of China; Yang Zaiping, Executive Vice President of China Banking Association; Citi China CEO Andrew Au; Duan Yingbi, President of China Foundation for Poverty Alleviation (CFPA); Cui Yu, Director of Development Department, All-China Women's Federation; Yuan Shuwei, Deputy Director of Career Center of Human Resources and Social Security Ministry; and Professor Du Xiaoshan, Deputy Director of Institute of Rural Development, Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, took part in the event.
tag-5: This year, the award committee received several hundred applications from 22 provinces, significantly more than the previous years. In order to promote outstanding microfinance institutions which have achieved financial, social and comprehensive performance, for the first time the 2012 awards included five institutional awards: Best Sustainable Award, Best Risk Management Award, Best Social Performance Award, Best Inclusive Financial Award, as well as Most Innovative MFI (Microfinance Institution) Award. The committee also received 35,449 votes from online voters.
tag-6: Ultimately, China Foundation for Poverty Alleviation (CFPA) won the Most Innovative MFI Award and Miss Hou Qihui from the Bureau of Shijiazhuang Employment Bureau won the Microentrepreneur of the Year Award. A collection of stories from 100 micro-entrepreneurs, entitled Lend Me a Pair of Wings (II), was also launched at the ceremony and presented to the winners as a gift.
tag-7: Wu Xiaoling recognized the positive contribution of microfinance to economic and social development, praised the performance of award-winning microfinance institutions and individuals and, once again, strongly urged a more rational policy set-up and regulatory regime for microfinance development. She also noted that financial institutions should cherish the hard-won development environment and strengthen self-discipline so as to prevent risks and promote healthy and sustainable development of the microfinance sector.
tag-8: Yang Zaiping said: "The China Banking Association is delighted to cooperate with Citi Foundation to support the China Microentrepreneurship Awards since 2005. Over the past years, we have not only seen a boom in the microfinance sector in China, but also witnessed the effectiveness of microfinance as a tool to eliminate poverty and to help disadvantaged groups. We welcome more social attention to this area so that microfinance can become a dynamic force used to promote social harmony and progress.
tag-9: Andrew Au, Chief Executive Officer of Citi China, said: "Citi has been a proud supporter of this important award series in China for the past eight years. We are committed to contributing to microfinance and the inclusive financial development of China. We hope to introduce our extensive experience in helping microfinance development around the world to China, to improve the capacity building of microfinance institutions, to make financial services more accessible to those underserved individuals and small businesses and to help build a stronger community."
tag-10: Citi is one of the leading corporate supporters of microfinance, microenterprise and financial inclusion in China and around the world. In China, Citi has helped to establish the China Association of Microfinance, Microfinance Training Center and support the capability building of the microfinance sector. The awards were established in China in 2005 through the support of the Citi Foundation to recognize the efforts of microentrepreneurs while also raising awareness of the importance of microfinance efforts to increase access to finance.
tag-11: For more details about this award and microfinance development in China, please visit the dedicated microsite at http://gongyi.sina.com.cn/z/microfinance/index.shtml.

tag-14: The China Banking Association (CBA) The China Banking Association (CBA) is a national banking self-governing organization and is a non-profit institutional legal entity registered with the Ministry of Civil Affairs with the approval of the China Banking Regulatory Commission. National financial institutions within banking sectors established with the approval of China Banking Regulatory Commission with independent legal entity qualification, as well as foreign financial institutions operating in China may apply to join the Association.
tag-15: The Association aims to promote the members' common interests by complying with the Constitution, laws, regulations, economic and financial policies, fulfilling the functions of self-discipline, protection of rights, coordination and service with due diligence in accordance with Law of the People's Republic of China on Commercial Banks, Law on the People s Bank of China, Law of the People's Republic of China on Banking Regulation and Supervision, protecting the legal rights and benefits of the banking sector, maintaining the market order of the banking sector, improving the quality of the banking practitioners, improving service level and promoting healthy development of the banking sector. Please visit www.china-cba.net for more information.
tag-16: Citi China  Citi first established an office in China on May 15, 1902, in Shanghai. In April 2007, Citi was among the first international banks to locally incorporate in China. Citi's locally incorporated entity is known as Citibank (China) Co Ltd, which is wholly owned by Citibank N.A. Today Citi is a leading international bank in China, and has 13 corporate bank branches - in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Chengdu, Hangzhou, Dalian, Chongqing, Guiyang, Nanjing, Changsha and Wuxi- and 51 consumer bank outlets. With operations in more than 160 countries around the world, Citi is the most global of all international banks in China.
tag-17: Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving on its priority focus areas: Microfinance and Microenterprise, Small and Growing Businesses, Education, and Financial Education and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Microenterprise and Small and Growing Businesses to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at http://www.citifoundation.com.
